title: Revert operation is slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: The revert operation in the java editor is significantly slower than the close and reopen operations.
OB: The revert operation should not take longer than closing and reopening the file.
EB: However, it seems that the revert operation is taking more time compared to the close and reopen operations.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open-source repository. 
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty. 

On my machine, it takes about 8 seconds to perform the following steps: 
1) Click on the close box in the editor tab. 
2) Choose 'No' when prompted to save changes. 
3) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 

However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2) and then select 'Revert' from the popup menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
